page.title: 13Old Railway Lines
page.content: The railways running through Daubhill and Great Lever are now defunct. The one which used to run by Swan Lane Mill was very important and was opened in 1828 before the famous Liverpool/Manchester line, but it is now derelict. It is badly overgrown and a lot of fly-tipping has gone on. It looks a mess! Someone should do something about it. It isn't very nice for the people who live nearby. There is another defunct railway line but this looks very attractive. It runs alongside Pennington Road and has been extensively{landscaped}for use as a{recreation area.}This is good idea because most of the nearby houses are terraced with no gardens and the railway development gives the local people some greenery to look at. No{working lines}run through our area. Anne-Marie McDermott.
